isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/ TRACTION CONTROL TROUBLESHOOTING: BENDIX - 9100, 9200, 9300 and 9400 Models Built March 1, 1998 and After - TROUBLESHOOTING - INITIAL START-UP DESCRIPTION

svcprocinfo.para: For a vehicle without any system defects, the following information describes "normal behavior" during the engine start-up.

The controller will begin start-up diagnostics when the key is turned to the ON position. Applying the service brakes while the controller performs its self-test will produce a "chuff" sound as air exhausts from the M-22 modulators.

svcsubproc.title: Normal Start-Up
svcsubproc.para: Each M-22 modulator contains one (1) exhaust solenoid and one (1) hold solenoid. During the start-up test, the controller will "fire" or energize each solenoid briefly in a test cycle making a "chuff" sound as the air exhausts. The exhaust solenoid will be "fired" for 10 milliseconds, then a pause for only a few milliseconds and the hold solenoid will "fire" for 20 milliseconds. The two firing in rapid sequence produces a single "chuff" sound. If the solenoids are wired incorrectly, or if only one is firing, the sound will be distinctly different. The controller will begin at the right front, then go to the left front, then the right rear, and finish the cycle on the left rear. It will then repeat the cycle, making two complete cycles. The second cycle is a repeat of the first.

When the engine is started (or key switch turned to ON position), the controller first runs a series of modulator tests as described in the preceding paragraph. The controller begins at the right front M-22 modulator and fires each of the (2) solenoids contained in the modulator, then moves to the left front modulator and fires each of the (2) solenoids in that modulator and moves to the right rear modulator, again firing both solenoids, and finally moves to the left rear and fires each of the (2) solenoids in that modulator. The cycle will be repeated one more time, in the same sequence.

After the modulator test is complete, then the yellow instrument panel ABS warning light will flash twice, then the warning light will "go out." Once the vehicle is driven 7-10 mph the light may come back on if a wheel speed sensor problem is detected.

The Traction Active Light will turn ON briefly as a bulb test during the start-up test, then turn OFF. During normal operation this light will only turn ON while the controller is actively working to reduce a wheel slip condition during acceleration.
This behavior indicates the antilock system is performing correctly. The controller will continue to monitor system performance and illuminate the warning light if a problem is detected.

svcsubproc.title: Start-up With Defect In System
svcsubproc.para: If the system is started and the instrument panel ABS warning light does not perform as described above, a system fault is present. The ABS yellow warning light:

item.para: Or may illuminate (but not flash twice) and stay on.
Or may flash twice and illuminate.

svcsubproc.para: The Traction Active Light does not turn ON for a bulb test or turns ON and does not turn OFF.

Any of the preceding actions indicates that the controller has detected a fault in the system. Perform INITIAL START-UP TEST PROCEDURE
.
